text: These rules may be called the International Financial Services Centres Authority Rules, 2020. They shall come into force on the date of publication in the Official Gazette.

Definitions include: (a) 'Act' means the International Financial Services Centres Authority Act of 2019; (b) 'Chairperson' means the Chairperson of the Authority appointed under section 5(1)(a) of the Act; (c) 'Member' refers to a member appointed under section 5(1)(d); (d) 'Selection Committee' means the committee constituted under rule 3.

The Chairperson and Members shall be appointed by the Central Government on recommendation of a Selection Committee, consisting of senior government officials and experts in relevant fields. The Committee shall recommend a panel of two or three suitable candidates per post.
No person shall be appointed as Chairperson or whole-time Member unless medically fit as certified by a competent authority designated by the Central Government.

If a written complaint alleges misbehavior or incapacity of a Chairperson or whole-time Member, the Central Government shall preliminarily examine the complaint. If grounds are found, it will refer the matter to the Selection Committee to conduct an inquiry.

The Selection Committee will complete its inquiry within the time specified and submit a report with its findings. The Committee shall follow natural justice principles and regulate its own procedure.

The Chairperson and whole-time Members shall not have financial or other interests that prejudicially affect their functions. They must declare assets, liabilities, and interests before taking office.

The Chairperson and whole-time Members are restricted from accepting government or financial institution employment in the International Financial Services Centres for two years post-tenure, without prior approval from the Central Government.

The Chairperson may choose to receive pay equivalent to a Government Secretary or a consolidated salary of Rs. 4,50,000 per month. A whole-time Member may choose between pay of an Additional Secretary or Rs. 4,00,000 monthly.
If the Chairperson or Member is retired and receiving pension or benefits, their salary will be reduced by the amount of those benefits.
Chairperson and whole-time Members receiving Secretary or Additional Secretary pay are entitled to dearness allowance at Group 'A' officer rates.
An entertainment allowance of up to Rs. 6,000 per annum shall be provided to the Chairperson and whole-time Members.
Chairperson and Members are entitled to earned leave, half pay leave, casual leave, restricted holidays, and extraordinary leave as per specified conditions.
Chairperson is the authority to sanction leave for Members. Central Government sanctions leave for the Chairperson and foreign travel for both.
Chairperson and whole-time Members are governed by the Contributory Provident Fund (India) Rules, 1962 and the Contribution Pension System.
Chairperson and Members are entitled to travel allowances on tour, transfer, and joining or exiting the office, as applicable to a Secretary or equivalent rank officer.
They are entitled to Leave Travel Concession as per norms for a Secretary or Group 'A' officer, respectively.
Rent-free unfurnished accommodation shall be provided as per rank entitlement, with water, electricity, and fuel charges borne by the occupant.
If occupying private accommodation, they are entitled to a housing allowance and 10% of basic pay as compensation.
Chairperson and Members shall be provided with a staff car for official use. Vehicles shall be hired, not purchased.
Chairperson and whole-time Members are not entitled to any bonus or sitting fees for attending meetings of the Authority.
They are entitled to encashment of up to 50% of earned leave credit at any time. Leave salary follows Central Civil Services rules.
Medical treatment shall be provided under a health scheme specified by the Central Government.
Conditions not covered in these rules shall be referred to the Central Government, whose decision shall be final.
A part-time Member must not hold any conflicting interest and may be appointed for up to three years, with eligibility for reappointment.
Part-time Members receive Rs. 6,000 per meeting attended and travel allowances equivalent to an Additional Secretary of the Government of India.
The Central Government has the power to relax these rules for any class or category of persons.
